pr_title: [JBPM-9184] Subprocess excepcion handling tx rollback causes main process to fail

timeline.bodyText:
is not already handled in the following code?
https://github.com/kiegroup/drools/blob/master/drools-persistence/drools-persistence-api/src/main/java/org/drools/persistence/jta/JtaTransactionManager.java#L264-L275
If not, would it make more sense to add this condition to the rollbackTransaction method?
https://github.com/kiegroup/drools/blob/master/drools-persistence/drools-persistence-jpa/src/main/java/org/drools/persistence/PersistableRunner.java#L406
timeline.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText:
Actually that code block is that cause of the problem. I removed from the exeuction flow.
When you are executing a workflow you don't want the subprocess to control the transaction (mark it as rollback).
The only doubt about this one is checking about tx control in a EJB container managed. As I am not allowing the tx rolling back it will happen during ejb tx interceptor as it will catch the tx problem.
I am kind unsure about that
@gmunozfe @afalhambra  wdyt ?
replies.author: elguardian

replies.bodyText: As discussed already, it works fine in transaction managed container based like springboot, though as you said I'm not sure about EJBs behavior. Maybe it is worth to give it a try in some other app server?
replies.author: afalhambra

timeline.message:
[JBPM-9184] Subprocess excepcion handling tx rollback causes main process to fail

The error happens when a subprocess is invoked sync and therefore is not the owner of the tx.
In this case we need to let the main process handle the rollback
